[i]Lor had a rich mum who got them toys of bone. Tim got the wooden toys so he needn't be alone. But Keri had but dulce and flour with naught a pence to spare. So she made a friend of sackcloth and stitched it with her hair.
—Child-rhymes of Yesterday. [/i]
[i]“Of course I can carry them; they're accessories.”[/i]
